title: Question 76

children: A 50-year-old malnourished man is evaluated for the skin findings
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This image shows perifollicular petechiae of the skin caused by a vitamin C deficiency, also known as scurvy. Perifollicular petechiae of the skin occur around the skin's hair follicles as the name suggests and are small (â‰¤2 mm) hemorrhages, which occur due to the frailty of the capillary walls. Other signs of vitamin C deficiency include coiled hairs, bruising, and impaired wound healing. Patients commonly develop gingivitis
, as well as gingival hemorrhages, also caused by capillary frailty.

objective.__html: Diagnose perifollicular hemorrhage caused by vitamin C deficiency.
